column2: IJSDK-474 Clarify definition of "IDEA jdk" in README.md

column3: This change attempts to clarify whether users should define the IDEA jdk based on JDK 1.6 or 1.8.

I found explaining this definition to be tricky because there are three audiences: plugin developers, internal engineers, and contributors to the IntelliJ IDEA Community Edition open source project.  I tried to reach the plugin developer audience first, and clarify which JDK should be used based on how a build will be used.

Plugin developers don't need to setup and build intellij-community project. If they don't use gradle-intellij-plugin which downloads sources automatically they may check out intellij-community sources (see the docs but they don't need to setup that project or build it).
Thanks for your feedback. I was trying to clarify the wording because it apparently confused a developer. However, this might be a case of "better" being the enemy of good.
How about I delete this pull request and backout the changes from my fork?
Ok, I'm closing this pull request.
Initial clarification: use JDK 1.8 for plugin development.
